title: Top-5-chai-tapri-in-varanasi

article.heading: LAKSHMI CHAI WALA
paragraph: Chai is as ubiquitous in Varanasi as its spiritual establishments. So if you want to have kadak chai in varanasi then what better place than lakshmi chai wala. This shop has been serving teas for years. The chai here is thicker than the normal tea. They also serve amazing bread stuffed with lots of butter and toasted over coal

article.heading: KASHI TEA STALL
paragraph: At Kashi tea stall not only do they have amazing tea but also they serve rich flavoured coffee. The name might confuse some, but Kashi is actually the name of the owner of Kashi tea stall who runs it along with his son. With the super friendly and helpful staff your experience of this place will surely be remarkable.

article.heading: VISHNU TEA EMPORIUM
paragraph: Best known for its masala tea, Vishnu tea emporium is one of the best tea stalls in varanasi. The owner of this shop Vishnu is the most hospitable host, he walks his customers through his tea making process and has a very friendly and joyous atmosphere. And the best part is you can buy the masala, and different types of tea & coffee to take home.The place is hard to miss with its various banners all over the ghat and lanes.

article.heading: PAPU TEA STALL
paragraph: More than 80 years old papu tea stall is the oldest tea stall in varanasi their tea making recipe has been passed down to generation. The tea is made individually by adding all the elements one by one in each cup Instead of making chai conventionally by boiling it in a single pot. This tea stall is usually busy throughout the day but that won’t deter your chai experience in any way.

article.heading: KASHI CAFE - ASSI GHAT
paragraph: Your varanasi experience will be incomplete without sipping heavenly chai drops at Kashi cafe. They serve Lemon Tea, Masala Tea, Ginger Tea, Black Coffee, Cappuccino and so much more. Head to this place for some great green tea served in kulhad while sitting on the low lying wooden benches of assi ghat and enjoying the best of Varanasi. the hot piquant sips that you take while the cold winds from the river-side brush against your face, is something you will treasure throughout your life.
